It is currently uncharged.Is members only: trueIs variant of: Sanguinesti staffImage: File:Sanguinesti staff (uncharged).pngUses infobox: ItemWeight: 1.500Value: 5000000Version anchor: UnchargedRelease date: 7 June 2018Item ID: 22481

The Sanguinesti staff is a powered staff requiring 75 Magic to wield, and is only available as a rare drop from the Theatre of Blood. Named after the Sanguinesti region, the staff was crafted by Lord Lowerniel Drakan himself and given to Lady Verzik Vitur as a gift for her assistance in the Misthalin - Morytania War.

The staff has a built-in magic spell that can be used regardless of the spellbook the player is using and cannot be used to autocast any other combat spells. The spell gives no base experience and grants the player 2 Magic experience per damage dealt.

In addition, the spell possesses a healing passive effect in which successful hits have a 1/6 chance of healing the wielder half the amount of hitpoints dealt to a target. This healing effect can be seen via the 'upwards spiral' on the enemy; all other animations are the same.

The spell cannot be used against other players in the Wilderness. The only way that the spell can be used against other players is during the Castle Wars, Soul Wars and TzHaar Fight Pit minigames, as well as the Clan Wars minigame if the clan leaders enable it.

The Sanguinesti staff can be combined with a holy ornament kit to make a Saradomin-themed holy Sanguinesti staff. This cosmetic enhancement won't change the stats in any way.

A player using the Sanguinesti staff's built in spell.

Combat styles[edit | edit source]

Powered Staff
Combat OptionsCombat StyleStyle typeWeapon StyleExperienceInvisible Boost
AccurateMagicAccurateMagic and Hitpoints+3 Magic
AccurateMagicAccurateMagic and Hitpoints+3 Magic
LongrangeMagicLongrangeMagic, Defence, and Hitpoints+1 Magic, +3 Defence, and +2 Attack range

Charging[edit | edit source]

In order to use the staff's magic spell, it must be charged with blood runes, holding up to 20,000 charges when fully charged. Each cast requires 3 blood runes, costing 951 coins per cast. The total cost to fully charge the staff with 60,000 blood runes is 19,020,000. Assuming non-stop use, with one cast every 2.4 seconds equaling 1,500 casts per hour, the staff costs 1,426,500 per hour to use.

Players can uncharge the staff whenever and wherever they choose, getting all of the blood runes back.

Maximum hit[edit | edit source]

The maximum hit dealt by the staff is dependent on the player's current Magic level, starting at 24 with level 75 Magic and increasing by one every three Magic levels, up to a maximum of 39 at level 120 (obtainable only through an overload (+) in Chambers of Xeric). Both magic damage bonuses and stat boosts will modify the max hit of the spell; likewise, stat-reductions will lower the damage. The staff always has a max hit of at least 5, even when reduced to 0 magic. Compared to the other two powered staves, the Trident of the seas has a lower base maximum hit by 4 (max of 20 at level 75), and the Trident of the swamp has a lower base maximum hit by 1 (max of 23 at level 75).

Uses[edit | edit source]

A player attack triggers the staff's passive effect.

Compared to the trident of the swamp, the built-in spell hits one damage higher with a maximum base damage of 34 compared to the trident of the swamp's 33. The trident possesses the ability to envenom, while the staff possesses the healing passive effect.

Thus, the staff is most optimal in situations where venom or poison has no benefit and where healing is required. However, if the player's target is not immune to venom, players could initially use the trident of the swamp against the target until the target has been envenomed, then switch to the Sanguinesti staff. Notable encounters where the staff's healing capability proves very useful include the Kraken, the Chambers of Xeric, Dagannoth Rex, Zulrah, and Nightmare.

Kodai wand 75 107,985,806 +28 +15%
  • Can autocast Ancient Magicks, Arceuus spells, and standard spells.
  • Provides unlimited water runes while equipped.
  • When a combat spell is cast with the wand, there is a 15% chance that the wand will negate the rune cost for that spell.

Sanguinesti staff 75 63,229,426 +25 N/A
  • Slightly stronger than the Trident of the swamp, with the same stats but able to hit one damage higher.
  • Requires 3 per charge of the built-in spell.
  • Built-in spell damage scales with the player's Magic level and can hit up to 32 at 99 .
  • Has a 1 in 6 chance to heal the wielder by half the damage dealt.
  • Tied with the Toxic staff of the dead and Trident of the swamp for second-highest magic attack bonus.
  • Because the spell is built-in, the player does not need to carry its runes in their inventory and can use Arceuus spellbook, Lunar spells, or Ancient Magicks while wielding this staff.
Trident of the swamp 75 3,221,416 +25 N/A
  • Has the same benefits as the Trident of the seas, but with +10 more magic attack bonus.
  • Requires 5 1 1 and 1 Zulrah scale (instead of coins) per charge of the built-in spell, and can hold up to 2500 charges.
  • Built-in spell damage scales with the player's Magic level and can hit up to 31 at 99 .
  • Has 25% chance to inflict venom on the target.
  • Tied with the Sanguinesti staff and Toxic staff of the dead for second-highest magic attack bonus.
  • Because the spell is built-in, the player does not need to carry its runes in their inventory and can use Arceuus spellbook, Lunar spells, or Ancient Magicks while wielding this staff.
Toxic staff of the dead 75 8,921,265 +25 +15%
  • Can autocast Flames of Zamorak, Magic Dart, Crumble Undead, Arceuus spells, and standard spells.
  • Has the same benefits as the Staff of the dead, but with +8 more magic attack bonus.
  • Requires Zulrah's scales to recharge (up to 11000).
  • Has 25% chance to inflict venom on an opponent.
  • Tied with the Sanguinesti staff and Trident of the swamp for second-highest magic attack bonus.
Master wand 60 2,935,800 +20 N/A

Staff of the dead 75 5,699,536 +17 +15%
  • Can autocast Flames of Zamorak, Magic Dart, Crumble Undead, Arceuus spells, and standard spells.

  • Currently the strongest staff when used as a melee weapon, surpassing the Ancient staff and Iban's staff, and provides +17 magic defence.

Each cast requires 3 blood runes, costing {{Coins|{{GEP|Blood rune|3}}}} coins per cast. The total cost to fully charge the staff with 60,000 blood runes is {{Coins|{{GEP|Blood rune|60000}}}}. Assuming non-stop use, with one cast every 2.4 seconds equaling 1,500 casts per hour, the staff costs {{Coins|{{GEP|Blood rune|3}}* 1500}} per hour to use. Players can uncharge the staff whenever and wherever they choose, getting all of the blood runes back. ==Maximum hit== The [[Maximum Magic hit|maximum hit]] dealt by the staff is dependent on the player's current [[Magic]] level, starting at 24 with level 75 Magic and increasing by one every three Magic levels, up to a maximum of 39 at level 120 (obtainable only through an [[overload (+)]] in [[Chambers of Xeric]]). Both magic damage bonuses and stat boosts will modify the max hit of the spell; likewise, stat-reductions will lower the damage. The staff always has a max hit of at least 5, even when reduced to 0 magic. Compared to the other two powered staves, the [[Trident of the seas]] has a lower base maximum hit by 4 (max of 20 at level 75), and the [[Trident of the swamp]] has a lower base maximum hit by 1 (max of 23 at level 75). {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center; white-space:nowrap;" |- ! rowspan="2" |{{SCP|Magic}}

{{plinkp|Slayer helmet (i)}}+{{plinkp|Occult necklace}}+[[File:Imbued god capes.gif]]+{{plinkp|Tormented bracelet}}+{{plinkp|Ancestral robe top}}+{{plinkp|Ancestral robe bottom}} |- |75-77||27||29||29||32||32||33 |- |78-80||28||31||32||33||33||34 |- |81-83||29||32||33||34||34||35 |- |84-86||31||33||34||35||36||36 |- |87-89||32||34||35||36||37||37 |- |90-92||33||35||36||37||39||40 |- |93-95||34||37||37||40||40||41 |- |96-98||35||39||39||41||41||42 |- |99-101||36||40||40||42||43||43 |- |102-104||37||41||41||43||44||44 |- |105-107||39||42||43||44||46||47 |- |108-110||40||43||44||46||47||48 |- |111-113||41||44||46||48||48||49 |- |114-116||42||46||47||49||50||50 |- |117-119||43||47||48||50||51||51 |- |120+||44||48||49||51||52||54 |- |} ==Uses== [[File:Sanguinesti staff passive effect.gif|thumb|250px|A player attack triggers the staff's passive effect.]] Compared to the [[trident of the swamp]], the built-in spell hits one damage higher with a maximum base damage of 34 compared to the trident of the swamp's 33. The trident possesses the ability to [[venom|envenom]], while the staff possesses the healing passive effect. Thus, the staff is most optimal in situations where venom or poison has no benefit and where healing is required. However, if the player's target is not immune to venom, players could initially use the trident of the swamp against the target until the target has been envenomed, then switch to the Sanguinesti staff. Notable encounters where the staff's healing capability proves very useful include the [[Kraken]], the [[Chambers of Xeric]], [[Dagannoth Rex]], [[Zulrah]], and [[Nightmare]]. {{Magic weapons comparison}} ==Concept art== Sanguinesti staff work-in-progress.png|A work-in-progress design of the Sanguinesti staff. ==Item sources== {{Drop sources|Sanguinesti staff}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Magic weapons}} {{Theatre of Blood}} [[Category:Items subject to Grand Exchange item sink]]
